title: Drawing, "Ceiling Design with Rinaldo and Armida, Palazzo Milzetti, Faenza", 1804–05
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over black chalk on white heavy laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink, lower center: Rinaldo e Armida; in black chalk: squared off at sides 1-8 1/2 and at top and bottom 1-8
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: In garden setting, Armida reclines in lap of Rinaldo; both hold oval mirror in which they look at themselves. Amor leans on Rinaldo's left thigh. Rinaldo's armor at lower left; at right, two warriors spy through bushes. (Scene from Tasso's Gerusalemme Liberata).

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Ceiling Design with Rinaldo and Armida, Palazzo Milzetti, Faenza", 1804–05.
1804–05. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash over black chalk on white heavy laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-230.
